website_summaries.verdict: A great game made even better by the addition of a second player in the form of slimy “Gooigi,” Luigi’s Mansion is atmospheric, cleverly designed, and has its fair share of slightly-spooky surprises.
pros: Upgraded remake of the 2001 Nintendo GameCube classic
Suck up cartoonish ghosts with Luigi’s Poltergust 3000
Uncover secrets as you save Mario from the haunted mansion
cons: Since you’ll tour the mansion from top to bottom, expect to backtrack to rooms you’ve already seen a few times

customer_reviews.title: Great Game!
customer_reviews.text: This was a really great game. The controls on the New 3Ds XL are better than on the normal 3Ds/3Ds XL because of the c-stick, which is used to control the poltergeist 3000. I also like how you can choose to use a strobulb flashlight like in Luigi’s Mansion: Dark Moon. Even though the game is short, it is totally worth it. I think it is an amazing game. I totally recommend this game! Happy hauntin- err.. hunting.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Olavarria

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully made game!
customer_reviews.text: Game came out fantastic! The 3D graphics are nearly perfect! The only problem I have is that it’s hard to use the c-stick to aim the flashlight and poltergust 3000 but it doesn’t bother me enough to not love this game. Definitely worth the money spent! Definitely a classic! Edit: The achievement system is great and has made me replay the game in numerous ways. This game was meant to last this time!
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: Excellent classic
customer_reviews.text: Love it! It’s a fun and exciting adventure game exploring the original mansion where Mario went missing. It’s definitely a best seller like the original for the GameCube. So glad to have it. It’s a must have for anyone who likes Mario games and has a Nintendo 3DS.
customer_reviews.author: Ninad Ketkar

customer_reviews.title: Great Remake!
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this remake for what it offers. This game still deserves a 5 out of 5. I do wish they had the original U.S. Hidden Mansion, though. It has been updated to the PAL version (according to what I've researched) and all of the ghosts have about 50% more health on average while dealing a lot more damage and no hearts available unless you capture more than one ghost at the same time. Overall, I still love this game and I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: TBS

customer_reviews.title: Brings me back to better days! Well worth it
customer_reviews.text: Howdy folks! Man the nostalgia. The best type of games these days are the ones that bring you back to being a kid with no worries in the world. Luigi’s mansion looks really nice on the 3ds. The controls are great but just take a bit getting used to. Gameplay is smooth and fun, and the graphics are pretty spectacular. Lots of fun in a little game. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I had such high hopes for this game because my family loves the dark moon edition, sadly it didn't measure up at all. Highly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: (Luigi's voice) M-M-Mario? Mario-ooooooo? Mario?
customer_reviews.text: Even with his own full-fledged game, the whole time all Luigi does is call for his brother... Fun, replayable, nostalgia, a reminder to get #3 in October (really you should be dusting off your GameCube or Wii and play the original)
customer_reviews.author: Tech Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Did I just pay full price for a used game?
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was buying a new and unopened game but when this game showed up there was no slip cover on the game no plastic wrap and the game cartridge was not even in the sleeve just floating around. This is a Christmas gift and I’m really disappointed and thinking about sending back.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan A Shaw

customer_reviews.title: From the Gamecube to the 3DS Not Bad!
customer_reviews.text: This game is a good port overall! Only fownside I have is the controllers. It’s a bit difficult maneuvering Luigi and to vacuum at a specific angle. Neverthless, this game is a must have if you own a 3DS! It’s currently on sale, so get it while it last!!
customer_reviews.author: Jose Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Luigi's Mansion a+++
customer_reviews.text: Excellent service, the product is the one I expected. I'm a N3DS & NS game collector. First, there was a mistake, because I bought from 2 amazon stores, but their response was incredibly fast. I received the game and I'm expecting 3rd part to be released. Click4fun, thank you so much.
customer_reviews.author: Lenin Reyes

customer_reviews.title: If you enjoyed the origional, you'll enjoy this
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking to recapture the atmosphere and fun of the original, this adaptation does the job very well. Although the controls are sometimes clunky and the use of the 3DS's C-Stick is sometimes inaccurate, at its core its still a good transfer from the GameCube. Fantastic nostalgia fuel and good fun
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Meh, beat the game in about 3 hours, has a couple new features, i don't like the gyroscopic controls when trying to flash or suck up ghosts, as it makes me miss them constantly. Overall a decent port.
customer_reviews.author: Dodee100

customer_reviews.title: Great Entry to the Luigi’s Mansion Series
customer_reviews.text: Overall, semi challenging puzzles and great ghost and ghoul antics. Handles great on the original 3DS XL with no noticeable performance drops when the action gets intense. Music sets the perfect mood and I really liked the new Ghost designs vs the original GC ones.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: For the Game Cube feels
customer_reviews.text: We are enjoying this classic as a family while passing down out NES roots to the kiddos. Definitively seeing how this is being enjoyed by little one.
customer_reviews.author: Diany Moony

customer_reviews.title: Nintendo classic
customer_reviews.text: If you were fortunate enough to play this on the game cube I know you had a good time even if not now Nintendo has this for the 3DS and if anything I think it might be even better

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and fast delivery
customer_reviews.text: I am satisfied with my purchase and it arrived before Christmas. The item is exactly as described. This was purchased for my 5 year old grandson and he loves it! He is a huge fan of Mario and “Muhwigi” (as he calls him).

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: My son plays this game almost every day. He was so excited when it came out and can't get enough of the game.

customer_reviews.title: For Classic gamecube lovers...AND 3DS PLAYERS.
customer_reviews.text: Game is ported to a 3ds from a Gamecube version for 3ds players to enjoy, the very first Luigis Mansion game. Its not a bad videogame to play.

customer_reviews.title: fun

Now you can on the Nintendo 3DS that is and featuring a new Gallery to explore all your ghost catching needs. Now you can play co-op with the new Gooluigi in a old classic game that many gamers loved that started it all on gamecube. I'm Luigi number one!

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive for what it’s worth
customer_reviews.text: The game itself is great and the remastered graphics look amazing in 3D; however the controls can still be a little frustrating just like they were in the Gamecube version. My main issue is the price. I beat this game in one day and even caught all 50 boos, so it’s definitely not worth $40+ for a 17 year-old game that’s incredibly short and still shows its age. Would have given it 5 stars if it were less expensive!

product_meta.title: Luigi's Mansion - Nintendo 3DS
product_meta.description: Platform:Nintendo 3DSThe original Luigi's mansion, which was a launch game for the Nintendo GameCube system in 2001, is coming to the Nintendo 3DS family of systems. This remake has an updated look and new features, like a map that displays on the bottom screen. Luigi's mansion launches for Nintendo 3DS later this year.
feature_bullets: The original Luigi's mansion, which was a launch game for the Nintendo GameCube system in 2001, is coming to the Nintendo 3DS family of systems
This remake has an updated look and new features, like a map that displays on the bottom screen
Luigi's mansion launches for Nintendo 3DS later this year

specifications.Pricing: The strikethrough price is the List Price. Savings represents a discount off the List Price.
